description:
In Response to Trader Inquiry: The Pro Bowl does not count for this market - however, the Super Bowl does count.

In sports, a Scorigami is a scoring combination that has never happened before in a sport or league's history. 

In NFL's history, there have been 1072 unique scores. 

The most recent (as of January 14, 2022) Scorigami for an NFL game was when the Dallas Cowboys defeated the Philadelphia Eagles on January 8 by a score of 51-26.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if at least one more NFL Scorigami will occur between January 14, 12:00:01 AM ET, and on or before the final game of this season, Superbowl LVI scheduled for February 13 2022.

Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source for this market is an official NFL website (https://www.nfl.com/scores/), however other sites tracking Scorigamis will be helpful (https://nflscorigami.com/, https://twitter.com/NFL_Scorigami)

events.title: Will there be another (1073rd) NFL Scorigami this season?
